name: Proactive Agent Master Plan v2
description: From Working Parts to Autonomous Sales Copilot — wire existing 30+ Slack functions, 6 specialist agents, sequence executor, and proactive delivery system into event-driven workflows via a single orchestrator
author: Andrew Bryce
principle: Extend, don't rebuild. No new queue tables. No new preference tables. No polling heartbeat.

stories.title: Extend sequence_jobs table for orchestrator
acceptance: Add event_source TEXT column to sequence_jobs
Add event_chain JSONB column to sequence_jobs
Add trigger_payload JSONB column to sequence_jobs
Add idempotency_key TEXT UNIQUE column to sequence_jobs
Create index on idempotency_key
Create deal_last_activity materialized view

stories.title: Create orchestrator types and interfaces
acceptance: OrchestratorEvent interface with type, source, org_id, user_id, payload, parent_job_id
SequenceState interface with event, context tiers, steps_completed, outputs, pending_approvals, queued_followups
SequenceStep interface with skill, requires_context, requires_approval, criticality
ContextTier1/2/3 interfaces matching existing _shared/proactive/ data shapes
Export all types for use across orchestrator modules

stories.title: Build context tier loader
acceptance: loadContext() function that accepts OrchestratorEvent and tier list
Tier 1 loads: org profile, user prefs (slack_user_preferences + slack_user_mappings), feature settings, ICP, product profile, cost budget
Tier 2 loads: CRM contact, company, deal, meeting history, email threads, activities
Tier 3 on-demand: apollo, linkedin, news, template, campaign
Context loaded ONCE per sequence, stored in sequence_jobs.context, not per-step
Reuse existing _shared/proactive/ modules for data fetching

stories.title: Define event-to-sequence mappings
acceptance: EVENT_SEQUENCES map with meeting_ended, pre_meeting_90min, email_received, proposal_generation, calendar_find_times, stale_deal_revival sequences
Each step has skill name, requires_context array, requires_approval flag, criticality (critical/best-effort)
getSequenceForEvent() function that returns the step list for an event type
Stub skills referenced but not yet built (detect-intents, find-available-slots) marked with available: false

stories.title: Build orchestrator runner with self-invocation
acceptance: runSequence() accepts OrchestratorEvent, loads context once, iterates steps
Each step calls the corresponding edge function or skill adapter
30s SAFETY_MARGIN: if timeRemaining < 30s, persist state to sequence_jobs.context and self-invoke
Self-invocation via fetch to agent-orchestrator with resume_job_id
Idempotency: check for existing job with same idempotency_key before starting
On step failure: retry transient errors (up to 2x), skip best-effort steps, halt on critical failure
On requires_approval: pause sequence, create slack_pending_actions entry, return
On sequence complete: process queued_followups by creating new OrchestratorEvents
Cost budget check at sequence start (not per-step)

stories.title: Build skill adapters for existing edge functions
acceptance: Thin adapter wrapping extract-action-items edge function
Thin adapter wrapping suggest-next-actions (or the skill equivalent)
Thin adapter wrapping create-task-from-action-item (batch version)
Adapter for categorize-email (existing) mapped to classify-email-intent interface
Each adapter: accepts SequenceState context, calls edge function, returns structured output

stories.title: Create agent-orchestrator edge function
acceptance: Edge function entry point that handles POST requests
Accepts OrchestratorEvent or resume_job_id in body
New event: validates, creates sequence_jobs record with idempotency_key, calls runner.runSequence()
Resume: loads sequence_jobs record, calls runner.resumeSequence()
Uses getCorsHeaders(req) from corsHelper.ts
Service role client for cross-user operations
Handles OPTIONS preflight

stories.title: Wire meetingbaas-webhook to orchestrator
acceptance: After existing transcript processing completes (syncRecordingToMeeting), call agent-orchestrator with meeting_ended event
Pass meeting_id, org_id, user_id, contact_id (if matched) in payload
Non-blocking: fire-and-forget call to orchestrator (don't wait for response)
Only trigger if meeting has attendees_count > 1 (real meetings)
Don't break existing webhook behavior — this is additive

stories.title: Wire slack-interactive to orchestrator for HITL resume
acceptance: New handler for action_ids starting with 'orch_' prefix
On approval (orch_approve_*): load slack_pending_actions record, call orchestrator with resume_job_id
On rejection (orch_reject_*): update slack_pending_actions status to cancelled, send confirmation Slack message
On edit (orch_edit_*): open modal or redirect to app for editing
Register handler in slack-interactive index.ts router

stories.title: Upgrade proactive-meeting-prep to use orchestrator
acceptance: After finding meetings needing prep, call agent-orchestrator with pre_meeting_90min event instead of inline processing
Pass meeting_id, org_id, user_id, attendees in payload
Keep fallback: if orchestrator call fails, continue with existing inline prep logic
Add feature flag check: only use orchestrator if notification_feature_settings.orchestrator_enabled is true (default: false for safe rollout)

stories.title: Create detect-intents edge function
acceptance: Edge function that accepts transcript text + context (org profile, attendees, rep name)
Calls Claude Haiku with structured JSON output prompt for commitments, buying signals, follow-up items
Returns typed IntentDetectionResult with confidence scores
Only includes items with confidence > 0.7
Tracks AI cost via costTracking.ts
Uses getCorsHeaders(req)

stories.title: Build detect-intents orchestrator adapter
acceptance: Adapter wrapping detect-intents edge function for orchestrator
Maps SequenceState context to edge function input
Maps IntentDetectionResult to orchestrator outputs format
Generates queued_followups from detected intents (commitment:send_proposal -> proposal_generation event, etc.)

stories.title: Wire intent detection into meeting_ended sequence
acceptance: Update meeting_ended sequence to include detect-intents as step 2 (after extract-action-items)
Mark detect-intents step as available: true
After detect-intents completes, runner processes queued_followups
Test: mock transcript with 'I'll send you a proposal' -> orchestrator creates proposal_generation event in queued_followups

stories.title: Create find-available-slots edge function
acceptance: Read rep's Google Calendar events for next 5-10 business days
Identify free slots respecting: existing meetings, buffer preferences (15min), quiet hours, working hours from slack_user_preferences
If prospect timezone known, filter to overlapping business hours
Score slots by preference (morning/afternoon, day of week)
Return top 3-5 options with timezone-aware formatting
Uses Google Calendar API via existing OAuth tokens (google_calendar_tokens table)
Uses getCorsHeaders(req)

stories.title: Create calendar event creation endpoint
acceptance: Creates a Google Calendar event via API for the selected time slot
Adds attendees (rep + prospect email)
Sets meeting title, description, and optional video conferencing link
Returns event ID and confirmation details
Uses existing Google Calendar OAuth tokens

stories.title: Build calendar Slack UI and orchestrator wiring
acceptance: Slack block kit message showing available time slots with radio buttons
Buttons: Send times via email, Send calendar invite, Show more options, I'll handle this
On slot selection + Send invite: call create-calendar-event
Orchestrator adapter for find-available-slots and create-calendar-event
Wire into calendar_find_times sequence in eventSequences.ts

stories.title: Create email-send-as-rep skill definition
acceptance: Skill definition already exists at .claude/skills/email-send-as-rep/SKILL.md — verify it matches implementation requirements
Validate with npm run validate-skills

stories.title: Gmail API send integration
acceptance: Edge function that sends email via Gmail API using rep's OAuth tokens
Requires gmail.send scope (check user's authorized scopes, return clear error if missing)
Email appears in rep's Sent folder (Gmail API handles natively)
Thread-aware: use In-Reply-To and References headers for replies
Append rep's email signature
Track send in sequence_jobs with full audit trail
Daily send limit per rep (default 50, configurable)
Uses getCorsHeaders(req) and costTracking.ts

stories.title: Email HITL approval flow in Slack
acceptance: Slack block showing full email preview: to, subject, body (truncated with expand)
Buttons: Send now, Edit in use60, Send later, Cancel
On Send now: 30-second undo window with Cancel send button
On approve after undo: call email-send-as-rep edge function
All sends logged in sequence_jobs audit trail
Orchestrator adapter wiring for draft-followup-email -> email-send-as-rep chain

stories.title: OAuth scope upgrade UI for Gmail send
acceptance: Settings page section showing current Gmail permissions
If send permission not granted: prompt 'To enable automated follow-ups, we need send permission for your Gmail'
Re-authorization flow that requests gmail.send scope
Store updated scopes in google_calendar_tokens or equivalent table
Graceful degradation: features work without send permission, just show 'permission needed' when trying to send

stories.title: Wire proposal generation into orchestrator
acceptance: Adapter wrapping existing generate-proposal edge function
Accepts trigger_phrase from intent detection and meeting context
Template selection based on deal type, stage, discussed features
Populate template with CRM data + conversation context
Returns draft proposal for review

stories.title: Proposal review and delivery flow
acceptance: Slack block showing proposal summary with link to full document
Buttons: Approve & send, Edit first, Generate shareable link, Skip
On Approve & send: if email-send-as-rep available, send via email; otherwise generate shareable link
Wire proposal_generation sequence in eventSequences.ts with all steps
HITL pause at present-for-review step

stories.title: Create monitor-campaigns edge function
acceptance: Pull campaign metrics from Instantly API (open/click/reply rates)
Compare performance vs. benchmarks
Classify replies by intent (positive, negative, out-of-office, unsubscribe)
Generate optimization recommendations (subject line A/B, send time adjustments)
Flag underperforming campaigns
Uses getCorsHeaders(req) and costTracking.ts

stories.title: Campaign monitoring Slack delivery
acceptance: Slack block kit message with campaign performance summary
Reply sections with intent badges (positive/negative/OOO)
Action buttons per reply: Draft response, View thread, Mark closed, Add to nurture
Suggestion section with Apply/Keep testing buttons
Daily cron trigger via orchestrator

stories.title: Wire campaign monitoring into orchestrator daily cron
acceptance: Orchestrator adapter for monitor-campaigns
New campaign_daily_check event sequence in eventSequences.ts
Cron integration: existing morning cron triggers campaign check alongside other daily tasks
Response drafting integration: positive replies trigger draft-response flow with HITL

stories.title: Create coaching_analyses table
acceptance: coaching_analyses table with: id, user_id, org_id, meeting_id (nullable for weekly), analysis_type (per_meeting/weekly), talk_ratio, question_quality_score, objection_handling_score, discovery_depth_score, insights JSONB, recommendations JSONB, raw_metrics JSONB, created_at
RLS policies: users can read own, service role full access
Indexes on user_id + created_at for weekly aggregation queries

stories.title: Create coaching-analysis edge function
acceptance: Accepts transcript text + meeting metadata
Calculates talk ratio (rep vs prospect speaking time)
Scores question quality (discovery depth, open vs closed)
Analyzes objection handling effectiveness
Generates per-meeting micro-feedback (2-3 bullet points)
For weekly mode: aggregates coaching_analyses from past 7 days, correlates with win/loss outcomes
Stores results in coaching_analyses table
Uses costTracking.ts

stories.title: Coaching Slack delivery and digest
acceptance: Per-meeting micro-feedback Slack block (3 bullet points after each meeting)
Weekly coaching digest Slack block with: numbers, improving areas, focus areas, winning patterns
Action buttons: View detailed analysis, Adjust coaching preferences
Coaching preferences stored in existing slack_user_preferences JSONB metadata column

stories.title: Wire coaching into orchestrator sequences
acceptance: Orchestrator adapter for coaching-analysis
Per-meeting coaching added as final step in meeting_ended sequence (best-effort)
Weekly coaching digest triggered via weekly cron event
New coaching_weekly event sequence in eventSequences.ts
Respects user preference for coaching frequency (per-meeting, weekly, both, none)

parallel_groups.reason: Types and event sequences can be defined simultaneously
Skill definitions and proposal adapter in parallel
HITL flows for email and proposals in parallel
Schema and calendar function have no deps
